title: mypy 1.0.0 does not include error code for `"await" outside function` so it cannot be ignored when linting notebooks
body:
**Bug Report**

In mypy 0.991, mypy would assign error code "misc" when `await` was used outside a function. Though "misc" is non-specific, having an error code allowed for ignoring these errors when linting Jupyter notebook files (using `nbqa mypy file.ipynb` with [nbqa](https://github.com/nbQA-dev/nbQA)). Jupyter notebooks already automatically run cells in an async awaited eventloop context (see [here](https://ipython.readthedocs.io/en/stable/interactive/autoawait.html#using-autoawait-in-a-notebook-ipykernel)), so it's important to be able to ignore these top-level `await` usages in ipynb files. For instance, Pylance added logic to handle this situation directly here https://github.com/microsoft/pylance-release/issues/1754#issuecomment-1028462082.

As of mypy 1.0.0, mypy no longer assigns an error code when `await` is used outside a function, and treats it as a blocking error that prevents further checking. This means it's now no longer possible to lint notebook files that use `await` with mypy+nbqa.

I'm guessing this change in behavior was introduced in https://github.com/python/mypy/pull/14486 [here](https://github.com/python/mypy/pull/14486/files#diff-f782aad4853edceb67a88efe43d2869579d075a77b8e8dd2add91e818a9fa164R5168)

**To Reproduce**

Run `await` in the top level of some file (notebook or otherwise):

```python
async def foo():
    pass

await foo()
```

Compare:
- mypy 1.0.0: https://mypy-play.net/?mypy=1.0.0&python=3.11&gist=a97bbbf61fb0e0747b4f0a74d4a2124c
    ```
    main.py:4: error: "await" outside function
    Found 1 error in 1 file (errors prevented further checking)
    ```
- mypy 0.991: https://mypy-play.net/?mypy=0.991&python=3.11&gist=a97bbbf61fb0e0747b4f0a74d4a2124c
    ```
    main.py:4: error: "await" outside function  [misc]
    Found 1 error in 1 file (checked 1 source file)
    ```


**Expected Behavior**

mypy does *not* halt further checking, and mypy uses an error-code for `"await" outside function`, so that users can choose to disable the warning when that occurs. That will allow mypy to continue to be used/useful for Jupyter notebook files (for instance, setting `--disable-error-code=misc` when using `nbqa`).

**Actual Behavior**

mypy returns a blocking error and does not provide a workaround.

**Your Environment**

- Mypy version used: 1.0.1 or 1.0.0
- Mypy command-line flags: `--disable-error-code=misc`
- Mypy configuration options from `mypy.ini` (and other config files): any
- Python version used: 3.10+
